channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Disused (probably) light grey electrical cabinet on street with door missing and electrics exposed to elements, 14th June
item.description:
Disused (probably) light grey electrical cabinet on street with door missing and electrics exposed to elements On south side of George Street 10m west of junction with Gloucester Place outside Portman Towers, 95 George Street, W1H 7HN I'm guessing this is an an old Westminster Cable distribution cabinet (but could be another supplier) which is now disused and seemingly abandoned. If still in use it needs to be secured and made safe, if unused and abandoned it needs to be removed and the pavement reinstated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): George Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped mattress, 14th June
item.description:
This is becoming a recurring spot for dumping waste. This is the second or third mattress this year alone. Great if the council could find a longer term solution such as installing cameras.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Road, Shortlands, London

item.title: Photos show large pothole on The Green/Church Road Sidcup, 14th June
item.description:
Seems to be a pre-existing pothole that was filled in but now deteriorated and become dangerous due to depth and width of the hole. Will be a hazard to vehicles with potential to damage suspension and very dangerous for those riding motorcycles and bicycles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Green, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Private Gate blocking PROW, 14th June
item.description:
Someone has fitted a private gate with a lock across the public right of way behind 80 Durban Road, without consulting any of the residents. Is this allowed? Or can this be removed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durban Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipped waste is blocking access to the bin storage area at Saffron Close., 14th June
item.description:
Several household items — including a bed frame, a car seat, and a washing rail — have been dumped by the communal bin area at Saffron Close. As a result, the binmen have had to move the bins out onto the pavement, as there is no space and the area is blocked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saffron Close, Temple Fortune, London
Report on FixMyStreet
